channel.title: blog on Urologist | Dr. Yen-Ting Wu
channel.description: Recent content in blog on Urologist | Dr. Yen-Ting Wu

item.title: New Milestone in the Treatment of Late-Stage Urothelial Carcinoma
item.description: What is Urothelial Carcinoma? Urothelial carcinoma refers to cancer that grows on the mucosa of the urinary system (renal collecting system, ureters, bladder), and the most common symptom is usually hematuria.

item.title: What symptoms might prostate cancer have?
item.description: Most have no obvious symptoms Actually, most prostate cancer patients do not have any particular symptoms before being diagnosed.

item.title: Retrograde ejaculation
item.description: What is retrograde ejaculation? After taking medication for prostate enlargement, experiencing the sensation of ejaculation without the expulsion of semen is called “retrograde ejaculation.

item.title: What is a cystoscope?
item.description: What is a cystoscope? Similar to endoscopes for other organs such as panendoscopes for examining the stomach and small intestine, and colonoscopes for examining the rectum and colon, a cystoscope is used to inspect the urethra and bladder.

item.title: The Latest Weapon in the Treatment of Urinary Tract Stones: Tip-Flexible Suctioning Sheath for Flexible Ureteroscope
item.description: Last week, the manufacturer of ureteroscope instruments invited Dr. Wu to try out a new surgical tool: the “Tip-Flexible Suctioning Sheath for Flexible Ureteroscope"

item.title: When PSA levels are elevated, how will my doctor help me?
item.description: Excluding Common Urological Diseases First, the urologist will preliminarily assess whether PSA levels are elevated by considering factors such as the patient’s age, medications taken regularly, and the size of the prostate gland.

item.title: EXTRAPERITONEAL Radical Prostatectomy for Prostate Cancer
item.description: What is Radical Prostatectomy? Radical prostatectomy is one of the primary treatment options for prostate cancer.

item.title: EXTRAPERITONEAL Radical Prostatectomy for Prostate Cancer
item.description: What is Radical Prostatectomy? Radical prostatectomy is one of the primary treatment options for prostate cancer.

item.title: Diabetes and bladder dysfunction
item.description: Doctor Wu’s most frequently asked question during outpatient consultations: “Doctor, my recent urinary frequency has become more severe.

item.title: Risk Factors of Prostate Cancers
item.description: Recent news reports state that King Charles III of the United Kingdom will undergo surgery for benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH).

item.title: What is Prostate-Specific Antigen (PSA)?
item.description: What is PSA? PSA stands for Prostate-Specific Antigen, and it is one of the most common tests ordered by urologists.

item.title: Olaparib: a new medication for metastatic prostate cancer
item.description: Treatment for Metastatic Prostate Cancer For metastatic prostate cancer, commonly used treatments include hormonal therapy, chemotherapy, and novel hormonal agents.

item.title: Surgical Treatment for Inguinal Hernias
item.description: Currently, there are three common types of hernia repair surgeries Traditional Hernia Repair Surgery: Involves a 4 to 5 centimeter incision at the inguinal area, separating the hernia sac, and subsequently stitching and fixing a hernia mesh.

item.title: Surgical Treatment for Inguinal Hernias
item.description: Currently, there are three common types of hernia repair surgeries Traditional Hernia Repair Surgery: Involves a 4 to 5 centimeter incision at the inguinal area, separating the hernia sac, and subsequently stitching and fixing a hernia mesh.

item.title: Is surgery necessary for inguinal hernias?
item.description: How should Hernias be treated? Inguinal hernias are protrusions of the peritoneum, and the only effective treatment is surgical repair.

item.title: What is inguinal hernia?
item.description: What is a “Hernia”? What is a “Hernia”? Hernia refers to organs being out of their normal position.

item.title: Da Vinci robotic assisted en bloc resection of multiple urologic organs
item.description: What is en bloc resection of multiple urologic organs？ The en bloc resection of multiple urologic organs refers to the “bilateral nephrectomy with bilateral ureterectomy and radical cystectomy.

item.title: Refractory overactive bladder, really refractory?
item.description: Common symptoms of overactive bladder syndrome include urinary frequency, urgency, nocturia, and even urge incontinence.

item.title: Dr. Yen-Ting Wu
